job_title: Care Manager in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Flexibility, team work, supportive, learn a lot
cons: Pay is low, hard to move up sometimes,

review_title: Great place to start but not stay
job_title: Social Worker in New York, NY
pros: CHN was a great place to start. You learn a little bit about generalist practice and clinical work as well in a healthcare setting.
cons: There is no support from management in both the social work department and even for other departments. You are expected to see as much patients as possible, complete assessments, and therapy sessions, and help supervisors with their own side projects. When you speak up about it you will not be heard but you will be gaslit. This will ultimately lead to challenges and a lot of turnovers which I encountered.

job_title: Director in New York, NY
pros: Mission Centered and room for growth
cons: Healthcare Administration is very demanding

job_title: Deputy Manager in New York, NY
pros: Working with team to grow.
cons: Poor work/life balance, Senior team managers and CEO make all the money while the line staff does all the work and heavy lifting. Budget discussions are clearly lacking transparency. Transparency is not something you will find in this organization.

review_title: This place enjoys pushing staffs to its limits
job_title: Care Manager in Bronx, NY
pros: The patients are the reason why I continue to work for (CHN).
cons: I worked for (CHN) for over a decade. Since working there my mental health declined along with other staffs. Management put unrealistic goals on certain staffs, especially if you're black. They find ways to target certain staffs to get them quit so they don't have to pay out unemployment benefits. Management runs it like a revolving door of staffs. People are happy to work for (CHN) in the first six months, most staffs starts to realize management do not care about how they treat you. If you suffering from mental illness, I do not recommend working for (CHN). This place will push you to cut your risk. (CHN) only cares about quantity and not quality of their patients and staffs.

job_title: Nurse Practitioner in New York, NY
pros: Great staff, friendly work environment
cons: Limited benefits and limited budget

job_title: Care Manager I in New York, NY

job_title: Behavioral Health Therapist in New York, NY
pros:
Managers and supervisors were collaborative and supportive.
My fellow therapists were very smart and helpful. 
Decent pay.
Enjoyed the work with the clients.
Decent training offered. 
Is unionized under 1199, so there were 3% raises negotiated within contract.
cons:
Huge caseload expected of therapists (about 40-48 clients/week).
No breaks in between client sessions. 
30 minute sessions for a high percentage of caseload.
Only 4 hours of admin time/week.
Out-of-pocket health insurance was generally steep.

review_title: Lots of Work, not enough people

cons: Short staffed, high turnover rate, no room for growth, and low compensation

job_title: Center Director in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Honestly nothing. All i can say is that the co-workers you end up with become more of a "family"
cons:
-worst salary imaginable. ALL staff are greatly underpaid. No difference between holding a degree and not holding a degree. 1% pay raise equals pennies in your future checks
-Way to much favoritism. people seem predestined to receive higher positions. Spanish employees are favored over all others.
-DISORGANIZED. No one is every one the same page EVER!
-no 401k! you get a 403b plan and they put a percentage of your pay in there every year. very small percentage
over all it seems like one of the most unethical organizations I have ever worked in. This company seems like a good place for someone out of college but never to make a career. They are not generous enough with employees, offer minimal compensation and expect maximum work output, and employees leave or quit frequently (which brings down morale of current employees).

review_title: Great Place to Start Your Career
job_title: Health Educator in New York, NY
pros: I've gain so much knowledge in my experience working as a Family Planning Health Educator at CHN. The team I worked with were very supportive throughout my growth at the clinic. I was assigned to work at one of the clinic locations in Queens. The staff at the clinic were very friendly. You get 10 PTO days in your first year, 15 PTO days your second year and then 20+ after your third year with CHN.
cons: I wish the pay rate would be higher for health educators considering how much work they do. Retirement plans can be improved. Also, if you have any general questions to HR, they might take a while (2 weeks+)  or never reply back. (which is not good)

job_title: Health Eucator in New York, NY
pros:
It's a great place to get started right out or school or when changing careers.
The benefits are good in comparison to other non-profits.
cons: You'd be surprised by the bonuses that higher ups get, considering that this is a non-profit... one in particular got a $20k bonus when that's the yearly salary of many employees.

review_title: Offer Care Coordination to persons in Health Home program.

job_title: Patient Navigator in New York, NY

cons: The pay is low for the type of work you do for this company. Too much work for low pay.
